Cleaning up the mess is part of our job as well.{nl}Besides, we are barely handling the influx of refugees into Orsha, {nl}we won't be able to handle demons at the same time.
That is a superb choice.{nl}You will be able to choose what Status you want to enhance{nl}by allocating points every time you level up from now on.{nl}
It is difficult to revert decisions after allocating a Status Point...{nl}So I imagine that choosing wisely is important.

I've heard of your deeds. Talk about impressive.{nl}I'm not saying that I am not just a tiny bit jealous, {nl}but you can't work in Intelligence Command if you pay too much attention to contribution levels.
I may simply be working for the lord of Orsha for the money...{nl}But I am fully aware of how important the current situation is.
I don't know if I am willing to keep working as a Chaser after this.{nl}I mean, demons...
I've heard that you found the person that we failed to find.{nl}I don't know if I have ever been more embarrassed as a Chaser before.
There are so many monsters even near Orsha...{nl}Can you imagine what it is like further away?
Oh yes, you mentioned that you were looking for Mayor Romanas didn't you?{nl}The mayor headed towards the Temporary Settler Camp with Layla a while ago.{nl}
Could you possibly give this Grass Leaf Ointment to Layla?{nl}My legs are still shaking after that ordeal...
Tracking has never been this hard before.{nl}There are monsters near Orsha that I have never even seen before.
Impressive. You saved the bishop...{nl}Well, I at least get some satisfaction in knowing that I was right.
You know, I didn't nearly give you enough credit when I first saw you...{nl}I guess the lord has a better eye for talent than I do.
I can't believe I left Priest Pranas behind even if I was frightened by the demon...{nl}I don't deserve to be called a Chaser.
I thought that it was impressive enough that you could take on that demon...{nl}The fact that you saved Bishop Urbonas as well is simply outstanding.
These are just some rumors that I heard on the way here.{nl}They say that the towns on the far side of the river are also lying in ruins because of monsters.{nl}
We would have been in a lot of trouble as well if the lord hadn't issued the migration orders.
I'd like to work with you again in the future.{nl}If I happen to get the chance to do so.
I am so glad that Priest Pranas is safe.{nl}Rewards aside, I didn't think that surviving an encounter {nl}with such a powerful demon would have been possible.
You literally saved my live.{nl}I wouldn't have been able to go anywhere near Orsha if you hadn't saved Priest Pranas.
Please don't tell anyone about the investigations that we are conducting here.{nl}There will be an uproar if the refugees coming to Orsha find out.
This is... Did Brophen ask you to give this to me?{nl}Thank you very much.{nl}
Mayor Romanas went ahead towards the Temporary Settler Camp.{nl}I was here waiting for Brophen.{nl}
Oh, by the way, I've overheard Brophen going on about this.{nl}Have you heard about Skill Points?{nl}
I've heard that you can use them to learn new skills or enhance skills you've already learned.{nl}I'm sure it will help you in combat if you carefully choose what to invest in.
You've begun to become quite a celebrity.{nl}Rumors about you that were whispered outside the city can now be heard everywhere.
Thanks to you, we have Bishop Urbonas back...{nl}Now all that is left is to take care of the remaining demons, {nl}but why are they suddenly appearing all over the place?
I've heard that you were the person who found Bishop Urbonas.{nl}I'm glad that all ended well, but my job is far from over...
I didn't pay too much attention to the tall tales from outside the walls...{nl}But you seem to be the real deal.
I was wondering who it was that saved Bishop Urbonas...{nl}It was you! Goodness...
Medzio Diena, monsters, the influx of refugees, and the disappearance of Bishop Urbonas...{nl}I feel as if there is more to come. In a bad way.
Priest Pranas seems to have recovered quickly...{nl}But the air still seems to be heavy despite the cursed idol being destroyed.
Rescuing Bishop Urbonas is only one of my missions.{nl}But the pressure that I am feeling... It's overwhelming.
Oh good, you're here.{nl}We're thankful for the fair bit of trouble you've gone through to get us here.{nl}
So, are the nightmares still giving you trouble?{nl}That's a shame. I wish there was something I could do for the person I owe so much...{nl}
Of course, how could I have forgotten. {nl}How about meeting Bishop Urbonas of Orsha?{nl}
I've heard that he is the most respected cleric from around these parts.{nl}I'm sure he'll be able to resolve your nightmares.{nl}
From what I've heard... {nl}They are letting skilled individuals like yourself get into Orsha faster.{nl}
As it so happens, Officer Lutas wants to meet you anyway,{nl}so why don't you meet him at the Orsha Migration Office?{nl}I've been singing your praise to him for a while now.{nl}

By the way, I would appreciate it if you could help a few refugees if it isn't too much of a bother.{nl}There are many who are just too kind-hearted to ask anyone for help. {nl}I'm sure they would all greatly appreciate it.
Medzio Diena... It's already been four years.{nl}I did not see it in person, but they say that a giant tree {nl}suddenly rose out of the ground in the capital.{nl}
The tree was so enormous that many cities in the kingdom, {nl}not to mention the capital, were destroyed by the tree's roots.{nl}Many people were injured or killed.{nl}
But that was far from the end...{nl}Docile monsters became violent, and some swelled in numbers at a ridiculous rate.{nl}
The scariest part is that the demons began to appear.{nl}Demons that have lain dormant thanks to the goddesses began to appear all over the kingdom.{nl}
The goddesses... They didn't answer either.{nl}Even before Medzio Diena, they had started to be unresponsive one by one... But still...{nl}
Allow me to stop here as these are painful memories for me. {nl}Things are pretty grim these days as well, but I really do not wish to relive that fateful day.
What a gruesome sight.{nl}I've heard that there is not a place untouched by the roots and monsters after Medzio Diena.{nl}
Orsha and Klaipeda are the only cities around that you could say still stand.{nl}Times like these make people look around for things to depend on, {nl}but the goddesses are nowhere to be seen...{nl}
Oh my, look at how time flies. It's about time I went off to see the soldiers.{nl}Why don't you go see Officer Lutas if you wish to meet the bishop of Orsha.
The cursed idol or whatever it is is really unsettling.{nl}It's going to take a while for me to recuperate...
Pranas seems to be heading straight down to the 2nd floor after suffering from the cursed idol.{nl}I guess not anyone can become a priest...
Don't mind me, the orders...{nl}We must find it before Marnox gets his hands on it.
I've heard that there is someone helping the refugees, it must have been you!{nl}I thank you on behalf of our lord.{nl}
So... You're planning on stopping by at Orsha?{nl}As you can see, there are too many refugees... {nl}I have my hands completely full.{nl}

I understand that the refugees have complaints about having to{nl}abandon their hometowns because of the migration orders...{nl}I'm sure the lord wouldn't have issued such orders unless she had no choice.
It's not like the military and adminsitration of Orsha {nl}faired any better than the other cities on Medzio Diena. {nl}We've worked hard to get back to this state. {nl}
It won't be easy to send officials or troops to other regions for at least a few years.{nl}Especially since the demons keep heading south...{nl}
That's why the lord decided that the best course of action was to gather everyone at Orsha.{nl}Even if it means causing all this chaos.{nl}
The reconstruction of Orsha is still ongoing.{nl}It's not possible to let all the refugees who arrive enter Orsha due to some complications.{nl}
I'm sorry, but I will get to you once these people have been processed.
It's a relief knowing that Irma is safe.{nl}I think... I need to rest a little...
I am thankful that we were able to recover the orders...{nl}But I sincerely doubt that this is the end.{nl}
I assume that what is written in there signals the start of a new catastrophe to come.{nl}May the goddesses have mercy on Orsha...

Rumors that the villages on the other side of mountains and {nl}rivers had been destroyed by monsters spread like wildfire.{nl}I tried calming the people thinking that the soldiers of Orsha would come to help but...{nl}
The neighboring village had been ransacked.{nl}I could not help but think that the even the goddesses had forsaken us.{nl}
Thankfully, migration orders were issued to the surviving villages, but it was too late for many. {nl}They should have been issued sooner...
Not enough manpower, too many refugees...{nl}Sometimes I think it might be easier fighting monsters like the soldiers.{nl}
I wish I could accommodate you sooner... But look at it from my perspective.{nl}If I let you in before the people that have been waiting over there, there'll be an uproar.
You can enter Orsha without being processed.{nl}But the reason they are all waiting over here is because of the refugee qualification.{nl}
You can't recieve any support from Orsha without having a refugee status.{nl}They know that they will all starve without support so that's why they're all waiting.
That was a close call, since the soldiers were all in the middle of changing shifts.{nl}If it wasn't for you, that monster would have charged straight towards Orsha.{nl}
I take back what I said earlier about fighting monsters like the soldiers.{nl}I wouldn't be able to survive fights with those monsters {nl}even if the goddesses blessed me with a few to spare.
I guess it'll be slow around here for a while since everyone ran off...{nl}Besides, a person with your skills is always welcome in Orsha.{nl}
By the way, the lord of Orsha is gathering talented people.{nl}I think she's offering jobs, so why don't you stop by if you aren't in a hurry?{nl}
The lord is a strong willed and level-headed person.{nl}Go to the castle next to the Central Plaza if you wish to meet her.
Bishop Urbonas?{nl}Why are you looking for him?{nl}
I don't know... I haven't seen him for a couple of days.{nl}Why don't you try meeting the lord first since they are close?
Most refugees here haven't been to Orsha before in their life.{nl}That's why most of them would have thought that they would {nl}be protected by the massive castle they've heard rumors about...{nl}
I'm sure you'll notice when you enter, but much has changed since Medzio Diena...{nl}It's a pity sight for all the refugees that make it here just on the basis of the migration orders.
Greetings.{nl}I am the ruler of Orsha, Inesa Hamondale.{nl}
I've heard some rumors about a traveler recently.{nl}Said traveler has been saving villagers not even the kingdom nor the lord could protect.
There are even some that say that the traveler was sent by the goddesses.{nl}I have heard that the traveler... is you.
It was a mess four years ago on Medzio Diena.{nl}A gigantic tree sprouting up from beneath the capital... Monsters attacking villages...{nl}
Even the king and his army did not help us with the world in such disarray.{nl}But I've heard that someone still had it in them to help us refugees, it's you isn't it?{nl}
I know it's not much... {nl}But I wanted to thank you somehow.{nl}
Please gather some Red Leaves by catching Leaf Bugs at Ziedo Pond. {nl}I'll make you some potions that work well on wounds.
I'm not from Mayor Romanas' village.{nl}I lived in a nearby village that was destroyed not long ago.{nl}
The hunters warned us that monsters were heading our way... {nl}But the lord never sent any soldiers.{nl}
I barely made it away from my hometown when I heard {nl}that the lord finally issued the Orsha migration orders.{nl}
It would have made a lot of difference if the orders had been issued sooner...{nl}Not only are the goddesses missing, now I've lost my home and fields as well.{nl}
How are we supposed to live now...
Here you go, take this potion.{nl}It works wonders on wounds.{nl}
Thank you so much for helping the refugees.{nl}I feel like we can depend on you more than the missing goddesses...
It was okay back then because my town was far from the capital.{nl}Now... I don't think I will be able to go back.
To live holed up inside Orsha's castle walls that have been destroyed by roots...{nl}Or wait out here where there are swarms of monsters...{nl}
It's a hard life either way.{nl}I'd rather be back home...
I'm getting nervous since nobody is in sight when they should be here by now.{nl}You don't think they've all entered Orsha without me, do you?
The discontent of the refugees is mounting due to the sudden nature of the migration orders.{nl}Due to lack of facilities, long processing times... Even I would be angry.{nl}
What can we do though. {nl}It may have been too late, but this is the best we can do...
Survivors from other villages are trickling towards this place.{nl}Everybody is worn out from fleeing day and night without a proper rest.{nl}
They are all friendly faces... {nl}Yet all I can do is to craft stamina pills for them.{nl}
Could you gather some Rampar Mucus from Chinency near Ziedo Pond?{nl}That's the main material for crafting the pills.
All I can see in the eyes of people coming here is wariness and fear.{nl}To make matters worse, the goddesses are not responding either.{nl}
What would you think if you were the mayor?{nl}
Whew... Never mind. It was just the complaints of an old man.{nl}I am more worried about our young lord...

Sometimes I wonder if it would have been better if {nl}the migration orders had been issued on Medzio Diena.{nl}It's being delayed because they're haphazardly trying to solve problems four years too late.
I'm sure the lord had her reasons, but I wonder {nl}why she didn't issue the migration orders sooner.{nl}Maybe the messenger was being lazy?{nl}
There is so much I want to ask if I ever get to meet the lord.
This should be enough Rampar Mucus.{nl}Here, you should take some for yourself.{nl}
You can recover Stamina from Tree Root Crystals or by resting.{nl}But you won't have time for that when you are being chased by monsters, will you?{nl}
These Stamina pills will be worth their weight in gold at times like that.{nl}I'll pray for the goddesses' blessings upon you!
Did you by any chance see some people wondering nearby?{nl}The villagers from my town all got separated because we ran into some monsters...{nl}
They should still be on their way here since the only safe place is Orsha...{nl}I don't know why they're not here already. I'm worried that they are perhaps lost in the forest.{nl}
I'm sorry, but could you by any chance light a campfire on Adata Highway?{nl}It's for people to see the smoke and come towards it.
I've met only a few people here.{nl}I don't know where all the others may have gone...
Thank you so much for helping out.{nl}I just hope that they'll notice the smoke...
I think the smoke is too faint...{nl}Those campfires may be too small to be noticed.{nl}
We need a larger fire. A very large fire.{nl}Maybe the firewood that Official Lutas prepared on Adata Highway may be good enough.{nl}
I've already received permission to use it as well.{nl}Well, what are you waiting for?
Official Lutas says that there are too many refugees to simply allow them entrance into Orsha.{nl}
That's why they've created smaller refugee camps near Orsha and are supplying them there.{nl}The firewood on Adata Highway was also supposed to be used in that fashion.
I heard something loud... {nl}What do you think happened?{nl}
Oh my, a big monster?{nl}I'm so sorry that I dragged you into something like this...{nl}
The smoke is noticeable thanks to your efforts, but this is terrible.{nl}The fact that all we can do is wait here when such dangerous monsters are appearing...{nl}It makes no sense!
I haven't seen you around before, are you another one of those useless officials from Orsha?{nl}
You're not?{nl}Oh... My apologies.{nl}
I came from a place near the southern seashore.{nl}My house was unscathed, but I left because they said that they would protect us if we came to Orsha...{nl}
But as you can see, all that's prepared for us are houses unfit for people and a few campfires.{nl}There aren't even enough troops or officials here to help us either.{nl}
We've started to use what the previous inhabitants left behind {nl}since there is a shortage of pretty much everything.{nl}There are monsters everywhere else you see.{nl}
Don't you think it's miserable?{nl}There seem to be a lot of useful things in the Lumberjack Cabin, so it's a shame we can't go and get them.
It's not like the Southern Seashore is damage free.{nl}The massive fruits that came from upstream have totally ruined the fishing nets.{nl}
I gazed vacantly at the shore covered in the colorful juice from all those fruits..{nl}They all began rotting not too long afterwards. Ugh..{nl}
It was still managable since there weren't any monsters though.{nl}I don't know if that's still the case.
Wow, these will come in handy.{nl}You've earned my thanks in many more ways than those officials ever will.
You must not be from around these parts.{nl}People from around here don't wear clothes like that.{nl}
If you're a traveler... {nl}How about worshiping the Statue of Goddess Zemyna at Randoluma Rest Place?{nl}
Goddess Zemyna administers the Earth.{nl}She also looks after travelers on their journeys.{nl}
Of course, the goddesses haven't been answering our prayers for a while...{nl}But the statues still sparkle brightly when we pray to them.
I can't recall the exact date but... {nl}Yes. It must have been shortly before Medzio Diena.{nl}
There used to always be an answer when we prayed to the goddesses,{nl}but the prayers began to be unanswered.{nl}There aren't any people that claim to have seen the goddesses after that either.{nl}
The first goddess to stop answering was Goddess Gabija.{nl}This was probably around the time of my grandfather's grandfather.{nl}
Then Goddess Zemyna, Ausrine, and Vakarine fell silent...{nl}Now there's nobody left.{nl}
But I still believe that the goddesses have not forsaken us.{nl}There must be some reason they aren't answering.{nl}
I don't know who sculpted all those goddess statues either.{nl}From what I've heard, they've been around for a long time...{nl}
With the world in the state that it is there are some that are in ruin {nl}or have become habitats for monsters...{nl}In some cases, monsters are even indwelling in the statues.{nl}
Of course, it's up to you if you believe it or not.
Have you been to Randoluma Rest Place by any chance?{nl}A soldier from Orsha said that he'd be back for us if we wait there.{nl}
I don't know what the Orsha soldiers are thinking.{nl}We can't get there because of the monsters.{nl}
All we know is how to plough fields and cast nets, so what can we do?{nl}So would you mind clearing the monsters from Randoluma Rest Place for us?
I've felt a lot of resentment while abandoning my hometown.{nl}But coming here and seeing the northern villages changed my mind about that.{nl}
I just hope that the village will be safe until the migration orders are lifted.{nl}You see, the elders are still there because they couldn't bear leaving their hometown.
I can't believe that they told us to gather in a place like that with all those monsters...{nl}The lord clearly didn't think it through.
They're saying that people from my village have arrived at Randoluma Rest Place.{nl}But they've scattered due to the monsters.{nl}
I'm sure they're trembling in fear out there...{nl}Could you look for them and bring them here after you find them?{nl}
Even if Mayor Romanas and the villagers run into trouble,{nl}at least it seems safer here than at Randoluma Rest Place.
I don't know if they have actually thought it through.{nl}It shouldn't be that dangerous if they prepared it for us.
Thank you.{nl}I'll have to ask Mayor Romanas if our villagers can stay as well.
The reason I was looking for skillful people like you...{nl}Well, before we get to the point, let me explain a little about the situation that Orsha is in.{nl}
The appearance of Orsha... You must have been shocked as well.{nl}As you can see, Orsha is still being rebuilt.{nl}

The entire population of Orsha is being mobilized for the reconstruction,{nl}so we barely have enough soldiers to protect the city.{nl}In other words, we really can't dispatch troops or officials to other regions.{nl}
Of course, the monsters don't care about our woes.{nl}The collective damage to the settlers is growing, and there are already several villages that have been destroyed.{nl}
We are moving all of the surviving settlers to Orsha...{nl}But we don't have the hands, nor the resources, to work out the complaints that are piling up.
That's the short version of the situation... {nl}Now let's get back to the point at hand.{nl}
In Orsha, there is a grave matter that can't be announced publicly.{nl}We're turning to you for help since, as I've told you, we are barely holding everything together.{nl}
Someone with your skills should be able to take care of this problem.{nl}I know it's a bit sudden to ask of you to help like this, but we're grasping for straws at this point.
You said you're looking for Bishop Urbonas?{nl}Well that makes things easy.{nl}
What I wish to ask of you is to find Bishop Urbonas.{nl}
There is a figure that the people of Orsha turn to more than the lord.{nl}That figure is Bishop Urbonas.{nl}
Bishop Urbonas is the pillar sustaining the people of Orsha at the moment.{nl}That pillar is now missing.{nl}
I've been asking around to try to figure out what happened, {nl}but it seems as if the priests have all disappeared as well.{nl}
My men are all looking for the whereabouts of Bishop Urbonas...{nl}But it's pretty much a dead-end at this point.{nl}

If you're as good as the rumors make you out to be, {nl}you'll have no trouble in finding where Bishop Urbonas is.{nl}Just make sure nobody knows about this... {nl}The lord doesn't want the people being any more agitated than they already are.
Could you ask that person how much longer he's going to make us stand here?
It's been days since we've arrived, and yet we still haven't set foot in Orsha.{nl}Why did they make us travel all the way here just to make us stand around like this?
I'm tired and hungry...{nl}Missing a meal would've been unthinkable back home...{nl}
They call us settlers, but we're basically refugees...
The settlers will panic if they find out about this.{nl}

A few towns have already fallen to monsters because {nl}the migration orders went out later than expected...{nl}So the news of the disappearance of Bishop Urbonas{nl}will most likely spiral things out of control.{nl}
One of the priests studying beneath him, Pranas, came back not too long ago.{nl}I've tried to ask him about what happened, but he doesn't seem to know either.{nl}

My immediate subordinates and hired trackers are searching the {nl}Woods of the Linked Bridges and Paupys Crossing from top to bottom.{nl}But there hasn't been any headway because of the monsters coming {nl}towards Orsha from all directions.{nl}
Even if Irma is still alive, she might suffer a gruesome fate at any moment.{nl}I hope nothing happens to her...
I must find Bishop Urbonas.{nl}The only place the settlers and I can turn to in a world where{nl}even the goddesses aren't answering is Bishop Urbonas.{nl}
Four years ago during Medzio Diena...{nl}I rose to lordship as I was the only heir after my {nl}father and brother were lost on that fateful day.{nl}
Back then, there were only the threats of people trying to manipulate or threaten me...{nl}Bishop Urbonas was the only person that protected me and helped Orsha endure.
First of all, there are reports of demons at the Woods of the Linked Bridges and Paupys Crossing.{nl}Perhaps they have something to do with the disappearance of Bishop Urbonas.{nl}
An ominous feeling... is tightening around me.{nl}Please find Bishop Urbonas for Orsha and the settlers.
Before you leave, please stop by the Statue of Goddess Ausrine in the Central Plaza.{nl}Goddess Statues will become inseparable guides for your travels in the future.{nl}
I've also taken the liberty of preparing a few meager supplies, {nl}so stop by at the Item Merchant to pick them up.{nl}I'll contact you again once you've prepared.
Please keep this a secret.{nl}You must not speak of the disappearance of Bishop Urbonas until this case is solved.
Oh, hello there, welcome. {nl}I've heard that you've saved refugees from danger several times.{nl}
The lord have been very pleased because she sent a person to bestow some supplies.{nl}There you go. I'm sure they'll come in handy!
They say that there are barely any intact cities left in the kingdom.{nl}All because of Medzio Diena four years ago... It's a real shame.{nl}
You'll need a lot of trivial tools on your travels like potions and such.{nl}Make sure to stop by often since I have the cheapest prices around.{nl}
Oh yes, the lord also requested something of Jurus the Accessory Merchant.{nl}Make sure you stop by.
Grandfather says that he doesn't know how many more people Orsha can handle.{nl}There are more travelers flocking here as well since {nl}it's relatively safer than the rest of the kingdom.{nl}
It doesn't feel very good even if the store is doing better.{nl}Do you think everyone can be happy if the goddesses return?
Greetings. I have heard of you from the lord.{nl}Things aren't going great but I'll give you this since the lord specially asked for something nice.{nl}
Everyone in Orsha is having it rough... {nl}But I feel as if we are getting by thanks to the people {nl}like you that go out of their way to help others.{nl}
Oh, yes. The lord was looking for you again.{nl}You should go back to her.
There has just been a report from an agent that was {nl}searching through the Woods of the Linked Bridges.{nl}It says that they've found a clue to the whereabouts of Bishop Urbonas.{nl}
Priest Pranas was the one who headed the search this time.{nl}He only returned recently after being away for a long time.{nl}
He has known Bishop Urbonas for a long time, {nl}so I'm sure that he'll be of great help in the search.{nl}

Go to Agent Cherasia, one of my immediate subordinates, {nl}who is at the Woods of the Linked Bridges when you're ready.{nl}You'll be able to find out what happened since the report and what they're planning to do next.
I've heard about you from the lord.{nl}Glad to meet you. I'm Cherasia.{nl}
I've been searching for clues about the bishop and the priests around here.{nl}
The other agents are currently disguised as being {nl}out on other assignments for the sake of secrecy.{nl}So I hope you don't do anything rash that will undo all of their efforts.
I'm sure you've heard of Priest Pranas from the lord.{nl}Pranas only recently returned from his asceticism from the north.{nl}
He recently found the traces of Priest Irma, one of the bishop's disciples.{nl}There were pieces of what seemed to be Irma's diary ripped apart.{nl}
From the way they've been ripped apart... It looks like the monsters did this.{nl}I was left here while Priest Pranas and the rest went to look for more clues.{nl}

I've been trying my best to gather the remaining pages from the diary, {nl}but it seems to be a bit too much to do by myself.{nl}You'll have to lend a hand if we want to cover more ground while searching.
It's unnatural for monsters to tear apart something as unattractive as a diary.{nl}My guess is... that somebody did this on purpose.
It's hard to recognize thanks to all the monster saliva...{nl}But it seems as if they were being chased by something.{nl}
You should hurry.{nl}Take this and go find Agent Moren at Gyvenimo Crossroads.{nl}
I'll stay here and try to find any more clues.
I've received word from the lord.{nl}You're the person here to help us right?{nl}
The journal Cherasia found...{nl}The fact that Irma is being chased most likely means that the bishop is also being chased.{nl}
Priest Pranas asked me to check the traces we've found here. {nl}Then he went up with the rest of the trackers.{nl}
This is where the bishop and the priests stayed for a while...{nl}The monsters are turning any investigation into a nightmare.{nl}
I'd like to ask you to deal with the monsters so that I can get some investigation done.
I think just a bit more will do...{nl}I'm trying my best to get all the evidence I can, so don't worry.
Paper burned by something... There's definitely something written on it.{nl}Why did they only burn some of it?{nl}
They've covered the campfire with leaves after dousing it.{nl}Not something that you would normally do. It has a great risk of catching fire.{nl}
Maybe they did this to try to secretly notify us of something.
)}Cherasia said that Priest Irma was being chased by something?{nl}If so, then these half-burnt notes may have been burned to hide something from her pursuers.{nl}
Whatever that may have been, there is a need to check these more thoroughly.{nl}Let me give it a try since it is my expertise after all.
Please look for more clues while I take a look at these.{nl}You may find some more burnt notes if you go through all of the smoking leaves around here.{nl}
)}There's no way people on the run could have had {nl}the time to make campfires all over the place like this.{nl}Do you think it's part of a charade?
)}Good.{nl}Let's gather the notes and see what's written on them.{nl}
A revelation?{nl}The bishop of Orsha... Revelator..?{nl}
I have no idea what they mean with the 'Revelator'...{nl}Do you know anything about this?{nl}
I see you don't have a clue either. Maybe Pranas knows something about this...{nl}Ulysses has gone with Priest Pranas so look for him up north.{nl}
By the way, there are also other hired trackers around here besides Pranas and the other agents.{nl}I'd appreciate it if you could help them out as much as you can.
Priest Pranas?{nl}He's gone to Paupys Crossing.{nl}
He left me in charge of the investigation here with a very concerned look.{nl}He asked me to look for clues about the whereabouts of the priests near Greate Stone Face Hill.{nl}
There are definitely traces of someone staying there for a while...{nl}But there are simply too many monsters for me to handle by myself. {nl}
I've heard that you're quite good.{nl}Before you head off to Priest Pranas, could you reconnoiter Greate Stone Face Hill?
Revelator? I don't know what you're talking about.{nl}Do you perhaps mean the people like the Bokors or Oracles?
Four years ago, Medzio Diena...{nl}...but that was only the beginning.{nl}
It was the beginning of a whole new calamity.{nl}We've been preparing ourselves for hundreds of years now, and we will finish our mission.{nl}
I only hope that Orsha will be safe until my priests and I can finish our mission...{nl}...sent by the goddess...{nl}
(You cannot recognize any more information.){nl}
A Minotaur... Are you telling me that there are demons?{nl}By the goddesses, demons this close to Orsha?{nl}
The bishop's diary? What are you talking about? {nl}It seems as if I am not the only person that thinks something dangerous is afoot...{nl}
Forget about me, you should head to Paupys Crossing as quickly as you can.{nl}My friend Talbasi is searching that region with Priest Pranas, so you should look for Talbasi.
You're the person that the lord's messenger told us about.{nl}How is the search in the Woods of the Linked Bridges going?
Demons appearing this close to Orsha is no small incident.{nl}There have never been any demons even if half of Orsha had been destroyed on Medzio Diena.{nl}
My mother will have a heart attack if she ever finds out that I'm tracking demons...
The monsters are pouring in... There's not enough manpower...{nl}They don't want to give us a break do they?{nl}
Oh, I'm helping behind the scenes to make it easier for the others.{nl}I'm dealing with monsters in Zbuka Inner Court, but they just keep coming and tired me out.
Eh, you're really going to help?{nl}For once I'm the one being helped instead and can't help out too.{nl}I think you really are sent by the goddesses.
I'll let you deal with the monsters in Zbuka Inner Court while I rest a little.{nl}They are more vicious than they look, so be careful.
There's a limit to what one can do alone.{nl}At this rate, I wonder if an army might be more suited to dealing with this...
As you know...{nl}There are barely enough soldiers in Orsha to protect the settlers.
It's less of a hassle to deal with two monsters than three of them, {nl}and one monster is easier than two. Thank you so much.
The soldiers took care of most of the monsters heading towards Orsha but...{nl}They've collected them and piled them together on those carts.{nl}
It stinks, and even more monsters have come to run amok since they've been left like that.{nl}Sorry, but could you possibly burn those carts down while I rest a little?{nl}

Forget the monsters going wild because of the stench, {nl}the fact that they're gathering near Orsha is definitely not natural.{nl}I don't know why they are acting like that. {nl}Do you think there may be demons somewhere?
At least I won't be responsible for any more monsters in my area for a while.{nl}Thank you for helping out.
Hey there, how's it going? {nl}It appears that you've also received requests from that person over there...{nl}
Do you want something really useful? It's a Monster Stimulant.{nl}Monsters sprayed with it will become hostile and attack other nearby monsters.{nl}
Why don't you give it a try?{nl}It will let you pass on some of the more irksome work.
Medzio Diena is a terrible memory for everyone.{nl}My hometown had been destroyed on that fateful day,{nl}and I'm living off these odd jobs in Orsha.
What do you think? Isn't it really effective?{nl}

I dreamt of becoming an alchemist before all of this happened.{nl}I only learned it by watching over the shoulders of others so this is actually a failure,{nl}but I guess it's all good if you can find a use for it.
What in the world... I've never seen anything like it.{nl}I went up Bonan Forest Road because it felt as if the monsters were pouring out from there.{nl}
There was a monster that I'd never seen before.{nl}It even made a nest for itself.{nl}
I was so startled that I ran away... Can't you do something about it?{nl}I'm sure that it'll threaten Orsha if we just leave it there.
If you really don't mind, please deal with the monster on Bonan Forest Road.{nl}There's nothing good that could come from leaving monsters there anyways.
I would have tried to do something myself if it was just a few monsters, {nl}but something of that size...{nl}Just run if you think it's too much for you.
You burned the nest to the ground? {nl}A wise decision!{nl}
The reason monsters kept pouring out from Bonan Forest Road is probably because of that one.{nl}There are even monsters I'm seeing for the first time since the surrounding areas are all forests.
You've found the journals of Priest Irma and the bishop?{nl}Hm... There are too many parts that I can't get my head around.{nl}
If they were merely being pursued, they could have just escaped to Orsha.{nl}Yet they went through the trouble of leaving behind pieces of their journals while disappearing somewhere else.{nl}
It could be... That they were threatened...{nl}Or they had a mission that they had to complete even though they were being pursued?{nl}

A mission... I've been looking for traces of Priest Gelija.{nl}I cannot make out exactly what is written in the notes left by Gelija either{nl}since they are only partially recognizable due to the monsters.{nl}

Priest Pranas said that finding traces of Priest Gelija is {nl}very important because of the priest's thorough nature.{nl}I also think that we'll be able to narrow down our search {nl}if we can find all of the clues left by Gelija.{nl}
I'll look over here. {nl}How about you look for clues that the monsters may have?
I'm sure that there is some crucial evidence in those notes.{nl}It is common for people on the run to leave clues behind so that others will find them.
I was trying to not care too much for Orsha as long as I got paid properly.{nl}But seeing the demons made me think about my{nl}hometown and how it was razed to the ground...
Thank you.{nl}It's not all recognizable since they're all ripped apart, but I can sort of make sense of it.{nl}
Demons are hiding in the forest waiting to attack us.{nl}A few of us were separated while running away. We... decided to group up.{nl}
Oh my, there should be a location of where they were going to group up...{nl}But that part is completely missing.
It seems certain that the priests decided to group up somewhere.{nl}Letting Priest Pranas know immediately is fine, {nl}but acquiring more definite information would be better.{nl}
I'll keep looking for clues here, you go on to Paslaptis Hideout.{nl}It's only recently been found, and there are reports that the campfires are still warm.{nl}
Even a small clue will be a big help in the search.

Report to Larena under the watchtower when you've finished your investigation.{nl}She's second to none when it comes to finding people, {nl}so I'm sure she will manage to find some definitive evidence.
It was the demons that destroyed my hometown, not monsters.{nl}Their brutality... Geez, I don't even want to think of it again.{nl}
If the whereabouts of the priests really has to do with demons...{nl}I'm sorry, but I don't think that we'll be able to see them ever again.
It must be you. {nl}The person the lord sent.{nl}
You said that there are only traces of hurried movements in Paslaptis Hideout, correct?{nl}That there was a note saying that they decided to group up somewhere.{nl}
I think that the reason they couldn't return to Orsha at once... Hm...{nl}I think it was because they had a mission more than merely being pursued or threatened.{nl}
Maybe that's why Jolly is so excited...
Oh, this is Jolly by the way. {nl}He's Bishop Urbonas' dog.{nl}
I thought that Jolly would be able to find the priests fast since he was adored by all of them.{nl}But it's hard for him to find a scent with all this rain pouring down.{nl}
I have to go back Orsha to report to the lord after meeting with a messenger.{nl}Why don't you take Jolly out for a walk?
I wish we had such a friend to work with.{nl}Cute, loving... and best of all, a great tracker.
Did Jolly find something?{nl}It seems as if the bishop's group was near here after all.
Wait a second.{nl}I thought I heard a faint scream from up there...{nl}
This doesn't feel right.{nl}You see, Priest Pranas' group went towards Gatves Highway.{nl}
They're all more than capable of looking after themselves, but still...{nl}Would you mind going to Gatves Highway just in case?
We are saved! Are you our backup?{nl}About Priest Pranas... He hasn't been able to make it out of Groundsle Hill!
I'm not a fighter, so I'll only be more of a burden if I tag along.{nl}Go after him quickly, please.
We should have increased the number of guards.{nl}I swear that this is the strongest demon I've seen since Medzio Diena!{nl}
All we could do once we made eye contact was to run.{nl}Priest Pranas will be in a lot of danger at this rate!
There was nothing we could do.{nl}Please save Priest Pranas before it is too late!
Whoever you are... I thank you for saving me from the bottom of my heart.{nl}Could I perhaps know how you came here, or at least know your name?{nl}
Oh, you've been sent by the lord.{nl}Then you must already know that the bishop is missing...{nl}
I was trying to deal quickly with a few demons roaming about and investigate the campsite...{nl}But then, we suddenly found their leader...
I... I can't keep holding on.{nl}Please... Search the campsite...{nl}
I'm sure we'll clear things out...
Come to Orsha if you find something.{nl}I'll leave the rest up to you...
There is just too much that I cannot comprehend.{nl}I'm just a hired hand trying not to care about Orsha... {nl}But it feels like my loss.{nl}
I brought Jolly because I thought he may be able to find clues without trouble...{nl}But the rain doesn't seem like it's going to end any time soon.
A demon that powerful... I've never seen anything like it.{nl}It almost makes me want to quit my job.
Thank you for saving my life back there.{nl}My wounds seem to be a bit more bearable since I've rested a little.{nl}
By the way, have you managed to find something?
Must be filled
There are a lot of disgusting monsters around here.{nl}No wonder nothing can be achieved in this state.{nl}
If you have some spare time, could you deal with some of the monsters around here?{nl}
It wasn't going great even before the monsters started interrupting my work.{nl}It was such a wonderful day until it began raining...
You've taken care of that?{nl}I envy your skills. {nl}
There, now I'll get to get back to my work.{nl}Thanks a lot.
I've never heard of demons being spotted anywhere near Orsha before...{nl}All of a sudden, demons appear and they're poking around this place.{nl}
They've made a bunch of magic circles near Naudingas Felled Area.{nl}I don't know why they've done that but it can't be a good thing.{nl}
It's not my responsibility, but I do think that it is better to be safe than sorry.{nl}Could you take care of the magic circles at Naudingas Felled Area?
I've been here to survey the land because of the refugee problem.{nl}I don't remember seeing any demons back then... What is going on?
What purpose do the magic circles serve?{nl}I don't think there have been any incident reports yet...{nl}We'll have to wait and see.
There is a lot of nonsense going on because all reports of the area are labeled as classified.{nl}I mean, they're planning on making a refugee camp near Deer Hooves Lot.{nl}

Even if the refugees coming here are supposed to be from a village famed for mercenaries.{nl}What are they thinking? Saying that they'll be able to fend for themselves{nl}if we give them houses... There are demons everywhere...{nl}
They want a report on whether the monsters here {nl}are weak enough for the mercenaries to handle or not.{nl}I used to be a paper pusher, what am I supposed to do?{nl}
I've heard that you're quite skilled.{nl}I can't fake a report, so how about checking Deer Hooves Lot for me?
If they're going to keep the investigations a secret, they should at least write a line and keep to it.{nl}How much more unlucky can I get? I haven't held a sword since training camp...
You're saying that there was an enormous monster at the camp?{nl}I haven't seen it myself, but we can't make people stay in places like that.{nl}
Right?{nl}I'll take your word for it and put it in my report.
This is just wrong.{nl}I came here as a surveyor, not to fight monsters like the trackers. {nl}That's too much for me.{nl}
The monsters may have become more violent because {nl}of the demons, so gather some monster blood.{nl}...Are you kidding me?{nl}Could you help me out? You'd literally be saving my life.{nl}{nl}
By the goddesses, thank you so much.{nl}Just gather some blood from the monsters at Rohonsa Cliff.
I'm not a coward.{nl}I just know what I can and can't do.{nl}
My skills aren't with a sword or spear, they're honed with a pen and stamps...
What is this disgusting stench?{nl}I don't know how they could have ordered me to collect this stuff.{nl}They know very well that it would have been impossible...
Thankfully, Priest Pranas is safe... Now we can afford to worry about ourselves.{nl}Having ten lives wouldn't be enough if we stay around here for too long.{nl}
Sendal and I have hurt our legs and there's no telling {nl}when monsters or demons will come after us...{nl}There's nobody but you to ask for help around here.{nl}
Could you deal with the monsters around here until we gain our strength again?{nl}
I should have known there was a reason to pay so much.{nl}I would have turned down the offer if I knew it was that dangerous.
If you hadn't help out, I would have been limping along until they got me.{nl}Thank you so much.
Oh... Whoops.{nl}By any chance have you seen some bags or packages around here?{nl}
I had all of my potions and food in there...{nl}With my legs in my current state, you're the only person I can ask for help.{nl}
They shouldn't be far since they weight quite a bit.{nl}I know it may be a bit rude, but could you look for our luggage?
Maybe some monsters have gotten hold of it. This just keeps getting worse.{nl}They're quite heavy so they shouldn't be too far away.{nl}
Thank you so much! {nl}They're not in perfect shape, but I'm just glad to have at least some of them back.
This seems to be... a chest.{nl}There's a seal, but it's familiar to priests. Let's open it.{nl}
It contains a journal and a map of Ashaq Underground Prison 1F.{nl}I do hope that he's not at Ashaq Underground Prison...{nl}There's something marked on it.{nl}
The handwriting on this map is most definitely of the bishop.{nl}Even though it is written in a language that ordinary people can't read.{nl}
I can only translate a part of it right away, would you like to hear it?
...Once the waves of disaster wash across...{nl}The stranger arranged by the goddess shall seek Orsha dreaming of the catastrophe.{nl}
Only one of the countless strangers...{nl}To find the one and lead them is our mission.{nl}
I shall go to the Ashaq Underground Prison with my priests.{nl}There, I shall await the one and only stranger arranged by the goddess...{nl}
We started being chased by demons even before we were ready.{nl}There is no time to contact the disciples that aren't nearby Inesa.{nl}
If someone finds this diary, I beg of you to pass it on to Inesa Hamondale, the lord of Orsha...{nl}
...That's all it says...{nl}I expected them to be chased by demons, but I didn't know that there was so much more to it.{nl}
As the journal says, report the contents of the journal to the lord.{nl}We'll also be preparing to go directly to the Ashaq Underground Prison.
There probably won't be a anything more important to Orsha than what we are doing now.{nl}This is worrying. No matter how hard I look, there is one piece of information that is missing...
If only I had a bit more time... I think I can find it.{nl}I'm not in the intelligence business for nothing you know.
It seems that...{nl}I am not the only one that feels something is wrong.
You mean to say that Bishop Urbonas... is being chased by demons?{nl}The Ashaq Underground Prison has been closed off many years ago.{nl}
I don't know what he's trying to achieve by hiding there.{nl}I... I don't know what to do...
I'll get ready to go to the Ashaq Underground Prison.{nl}You should hurry and inform the lord of this information!
It will take too long to gather troops to go there.{nl}They may not be of much help with demons since{nl}they only have experience against monsters.{nl}
I'm sorry, but could you go to the Ashaq Underground Prison with Priest Pranas?{nl}You're the only one left that I can rely on in this situation...{nl}
Whatever it takes, please save Bishop Urbonas.{nl}I, Inesa Hamondale, the lord of Orsha, plead for your assistance.
Bishop Urbonas always preached about the importance of the ties brought by coincidence.{nl}He always said that Goddess Laima would send a Revelator.{nl}
Yes. Maybe you...{nl}Maybe you are the Revelator that is mentioned in the {nl}legends passed down among the bishops of Orsha.{nl}
The church... Bishop Urbonas has been waiting for a Revelator his whole life.{nl}I will tell you more in detail once you have saved the bishop.{nl}
But you must prepare thoroughly no matter how much of a rush you are in, {nl}so please stop by at the Item Merchant.{nl}I have prepared some handy supplies for you.{nl}
Please forgive me for the fact that I can only help you {nl}in such a fashion even though I am a lord of a terrority.{nl}I shall pray... that the goddesses bless you and Bishop Urbonas.
I've quickly prepared a few things since the lord sent someone over.{nl}This anvil will allow you to enhance your equipment so that they become more effective.{nl}
I'd like to give you something more, but this is all I can offer.{nl}I don't know what is happening, but I'm sure you'll pull through.
It is so frustrating. {nl}The fact I'm restricted so much even though I am the lord of Orsha...{nl}
Are you coming with us?{nl}Having you with us makes us feel as safe as having a whole army with us.{nl}

According to the bishop's journal, the demons must be {nl}after the bishop since he's searching for the Revelator.{nl}It would be easier for them to go after the bishop instead {nl}of trying to find the Revelator who might be anybody.{nl}
Let's go to the Ashaq Underground Prison whenever you're ready.{nl}Bishop... I pray that the goddesses are giving their blessings...
I'll be right behind you with the trackers.{nl}
Let's meet up at Gebene Cliff at Paupys Crossing.{nl}The Ashaq Underground Prison is just ahead of that point.
You're here.{nl}I've gathered the best of the best, but this aura... {nl}It is sinister beyond my knowledge.
Torvana seems to be confident but... This strange aura... {nl}I feel goosebumps all over my body for some reason.
You can place your trust in me, Chaser Torvana!{nl}I'll take care of the demons in one strike, don't you worry.
I can sense the ominous aura streaming out from the direction of the Underground Prison.{nl}We may not be able to make it back out of there once we enter.{nl}
But we must save the bishop!{nl}Let's enter the Ashaq Underground Prison if you've finished your preparations.
It feels as if something I can't see is bound to me tightly...{nl}I'm finding it hard... to even breathe.{nl}
How are you so unaffected by all this?{nl}Maybe the goddesses are looking after you seeing how indifferent you seem to be to all this...
I've come here a few times when I was an apprentice a very long time ago, {nl}but I've never felt so weighed down like this before.{nl}
Let's see... I sense a very strong evil presence towards the Torture Material Room.{nl}I haven't seen that ominous looking fog here before either.{nl}
You seem to be in a good condition... {nl}Could you go and check what's happening over at the Torture Material Room for us?
This feels... exactly like a curse.{nl}I've never felt anything quite as vicious before.
What a strange idol.{nl}I've never seen anything like it even in any of the books before.{nl}
I am certain that the demons are behind all of this...{nl}But there does not seem to be a way for us to become free of this curse.
Don't worry about me.{nl}I'm second to none when it comes to stamina in the church.
Only you can stand up to Demon Lord Marnox now.{nl}According to the goddesses, only you... the Revelator, can save this world.
I never thought there would be a Cursed Idol here as well...{nl}This aura simply is... unadaptable.
My body... seems to become heavier and heavier.{nl}It's the same with the Chasers as well.{nl}

There's something I want you to do since you seem to be the most uneffected out of all of us.{nl}Do you remember the map of Ashaq Underground Prison 1F {nl}that was in the chest along with his journal?{nl}
All we have to rely on now are the points marked on the map.{nl}I don't know what you'll find there, but this is the best we can do.{nl}
Take the map.{nl}The bishop has definitely left some clues... at the marked locations.

Oh yes, in order to reach those locations, you'll have to take {nl}the rail system meant to transport prisoners.{nl}There's one at the bottom of the stairs just right of here, {nl}but I don't know if it is still functioning.
I shudder to think that I was almost captured by demons.{nl}You... Does the curse not affect you at all?{nl}
I wonder what happened to the other priests that ran away from Marnox...{nl}It weighs heavily on my mind.
I will become a more devout priest when we leave this place...{nl}I pray that we will make it out alive...
You... Oh, thank the goddesses! {nl}Does this mean that I may finally accomplish my mission...?{nl}
Yes. I am the bishop of Orsha, Urbonas.{nl}Who are you... may I perhaps hear your name?{nl}
Of course. Priest Pranas and the lord... {nl}This old man seems to have caused concern for a lot of people.{nl}Could I perhaps interest you into listening to me for a little bit?{nl}
Not long ago, Irma discovered strange orders on a demon while up north.{nl}The orders contained terrible plans that would destroy the entire region of Orsha.{nl}
But that was not all.{nl}It also contained orders from the Demon Goddess Giltine to get rid of all Revelators.{nl}
A Revelator is...{nl}...someone chosen by the goddesses to save this world from the catastrophes to come.{nl}

I wanted to give this information to the lord, {nl}but the demons had already started chasing me.{nl}I had no choice but to hide in this prison, {nl}a hideout that I had been preparing for a while.{nl}
I could have ran to Orsha, but if I did that, the demons would have followed me there.{nl}Unfortunately, the demon that was after us was not an ordinary demon, but a Demon Lord.{nl}
Demon Lord Marnox cursed the entire prison with his idols so that we could not escape.{nl}He also let loose his servants to search for us.{nl}
We had to make a decision.{nl}First, I hid the Demon Orders in the Penitence Room on the 3rd floor,{nl}so that it would be safe even if I fall.{nl}
Then I faced off against Marnox to the best of my abilities, but it was simply not enough.{nl}In the end, Irma was captured by Marnox...{nl}While the other priests were all scattered.{nl}
This is the story of what happened up to now.{nl}Until you showed up, I was thinking that I would return to the{nl}arms of the goddess without being able to complete my mission.{nl}
But my faith in hope has restored since you've arrived here.
Torvana was confident a few minutes ago...{nl}We were chosen because we were supposed to be the best, but look at us now.
Being so confident was a mistake.{nl}My body feels as if it is very heavy... What's happening?
Dispatched officers used to irk us by poking around before the kingdom fell...{nl}I miss those days now.
I feel as if I am experiencing every type of pain I could ever experience in here.{nl}At least I'll have plenty of tales to tell my children when I return.
I remember back home when they were first looking for Chaser volunteers.{nl}I joined up because I trusted Germeja, but the job is more demanding than I thought it would be.{nl}
Not to mention extremely dangerous as well.
You've kept dreaming of the Demon Goddess Giltine?{nl}Hmm... Perhaps...{nl}
Goddess Laima is responsible for fate and foresight.{nl}You finding me may seem like a sequence of coincidences, {nl}but I am certain that the goddess has led you here.{nl}
There were orders from Giltine to get rid of 'the Revelator' as well.{nl}I wish to see if perhaps you... since you have been having those dreams... may be 'the Revelator'.
I didn't hear anything about there being demons here.{nl}I didn't think too much of the job since I was told it was an escort mission...
I can't handle things like this, but I'd become a deserter if I run off...{nl}I'm going to seriously consider resigning after this is over.{nl}I don't know what I'd do to make a living though.
All I'm going to do after this is take a break and sleep all day while wrapped in my warm blanket.
I'm certain that the goddess led you here.{nl}All these coincidences are pointing towards you.
My goddess, your Revelator is finally here...{nl}The efforts of our church are not in vain...{nl}
Only you can stand up to the Demon Lord Marnox now.{nl}According to the goddesses, only you... the Revelator, can save this world.
Please save the priests and Orsha.
The most important part is the invasion plans for Orsha.{nl}I didn't have enough time to fully analyze the orders while on the run from Marnox...{nl}
I hid the orders in the Penitence Room on the 3rd floor...{nl}I sealed it as well, but there is no guarantee that Marnox will not be able to break the seal.{nl}
Not only that, but even though you are free of the idol's curse, {nl}you will not be able to reach the room if the priests are unable to move.{nl}
I wish I could show you the way myself but...{nl}I think that would be a strech due to the wounds I've suffered from Marnox...{nl}
This Orb of Return may be able to help us.{nl}We can destroy the idols with it and free the priests from the curse.{nl}
Deal with nearby demons to collect evil energy in the orb and destroy the cursed idols!
I will be of no help to you in my current state...{nl}If you destroy all of the idols, please pass on my story to Pranas.
Don't worry about me and look for the Demon Orders first.{nl}We must interpret the rest and find out the exact plans for the invasion of Orsha.
Has the curse been lifted?{nl}I suddenly feel a bit lighter now... How did you do that?{nl}
What? The bishop... is alive?{nl}Let us not further delay ourselves and save him!
I can barely move in this chilly aura...{nl}You, are you really okay?{nl}
You seem to be the only person able to move, so I hope you don't mind me asking a favor.{nl}We'd be in trouble if the demons suddenly attack us, so I want to threaten them a bit.{nl}
Gather some red crystals from Blue Dumaro and Wendigo near the Torture Chamber.{nl}It's similar to war trophies so they will be hesitant to attack us if we have a lot of them.
You seem to be fine unlike the rest of us...{nl}What did you do?
There was no curse when I came here before on other business.{nl}There were also only petty demons back then.{nl}
I'm only sticking around since I've been paid and bound to a contract.{nl}At least I'll be able to scare the few demons trying to get out with this.
I'm having a hard time even talking.{nl}Priest Pranas seems better off, maybe it's the priest powers?{nl}
They say that it's an eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.{nl}Maybe we can destroy the cursed idols with the evil energy from demons?{nl}
Mind if I ask you to gather some Black Wooden Pieces from demons in the Punishment Room?{nl}I know it sounds strange, but it's better than doing nothing.
The petty demons are here just like they were last time.{nl}I would have been leading you if I felt okay but...
What is this? Why did it suddenly turn into a normal piece of wood?{nl}Oh... Could it be the energy from the Goddess Statue?{nl}
At least I got to know that I'll be returning to the goddesses {nl}the instant I step away from this Goddess Statue.{nl}
Torvana says that the Blue Dumaro and Wendigo are carrying around strange packages.{nl}
The reason that they're able to move around in such an environment...{nl}Perhaps they have something in those packages?{nl}
If you ever find a reason to go to the prison, why don't you try gathering a few and use them?{nl}Maybe they'll be useful to you as well.
I came because they said they'll pay me ten times the normal rate, and I'm paying dearly for it.{nl}I should stop trusting those priests outside of the church.
It's not the effect I was hoping for, but this is quite handy.{nl}I'll have to show it to my colleagues later.
I cannot believe that you are the Revelator who will save this world...{nl}I knew it was strange that you were the only one unaffected by the curse.{nl}
Unfortunately I don't have the time to revel in the fact that I'm in the presence of the Revelator.{nl}Like the bishop said: Time is of the utmost importance.{nl}
Fortunately, the bishop seems to be safe for now...{nl}We don't know what's happened to the rest of the priests {nl}and we might be caught by Marnox at any moment.{nl}
Those Chasers are holding us back.{nl}I can move immediately since I am a priest, but they look like they could use a bit more time.{nl}
Oh well. I shall go first and see what's going on.{nl}Don't be too far behind!
I'm sorry. I know we don't have time to waste...{nl}I think there's a cursed idol here as well...{nl}
Fortunately, Draznie and Auranas seem to be fine.{nl}Let's just hope that the rest of the priests are okay as well.{nl}
This curse... I really can't get used to it at all.{nl}I think we'll need more Orbs of Return.{nl}
No matter how powerful the cursed idol is, the idol itself is merely a piece of wood.{nl}We'll have to aim for the instant it is full of evil energy.{nl}
You saw the cursed idol on the way here right?{nl}How about filling it with evil energy by dealing with demons near it.{nl}
Use the orb when the idol is full to the limit with evil energy.{nl}It will be destroyed as the divine and evil energies collide.{nl}
I thought it was all over when I was locked in the Solitary Confinement District.{nl}But seeing you... I feel as if the efforts of the church were not in vain.
The best part is...{nl}According to Auranas it seems that Irma, who was captured by Marnox, is still alive.{nl}
I also heard that Irma has a Orb of Return as well.{nl}We should hurry and rescue her before something bad happens to her.{nl}
Irma is currently being held in the Solitary Confinement District...{nl}Marnox is sure to be nearby, so make sure you're prepared.
I can't imagine what Irma is going through right now.{nl}I just hope that she'll be okay until you can get to her.{nl}
I thought it was all over when I was captured by the Demon Lord...{nl}Thank you so much for rescuing me!{nl}
But... I think I heard Marnox call you the Revelator...{nl}
Ah... the bishop...{nl}So the bishop is safe as well. {nl}Oh... that's... a relief...{nl}
The Orb of Return? Of course I have one.{nl}Here you... Huh?
Oh dear... It seems as if I've used the orb too much.{nl}It seems like it will break at any moment.{nl}
I've used it numerous times against that uncouth and arrogant Marnox.{nl}
It's too early to give up. There's a way to restore it.{nl}This orb is an instrument that turns powerful evil energy and turns it into divine power...{nl}
There's more than enough evil energy around. {nl}The Wendigo Escapees.{nl}
You can find the Wendigo Escapees near the Central Passage.{nl}You'll be able to restore the orb by absorbing their life and evil energy.{nl}
Please hurry.{nl}I think Marnox found out where we've hid the Demon Orders.{nl}
The seal that protects the orders can't be broken by a demon but...{nl}There is no telling what dirty tricks Marnox may play to break it.
I still don't believe I'm alive.{nl}I'm so glad that the bishop and all the other priests are okay too...
You've done well.{nl}Just a little divine power and it will be almost as good as new.
There's a crystal that Draznie prepared for such an occasion.{nl}I think... it should be in the Bird Room and the Supply Room. {nl}
The power of light should transfer to the orb from the crystal if you take it there.{nl}Return to me after the orb has absorbed enough of the power.
I don't know how many more cursed idols are in this Underground Prison...{nl}But the only orb we have left is the one I just gave you.{nl}
I don't know whether to call the bishop meticulous...{nl}Or whether to call him worrisome...{nl}
He ordered us priests to prepare things near Orsha.{nl}Of course we never knew why we were preparing things back then.{nl}
Then this all happened.{nl}If I could, I want to go back in time and kneel in front of the bishop in gratitude.
During Medzio Diena, it was a nightmare because of the earthquake.{nl}It was still easier to get by back then than it is now...{nl}
The fact that there are suddenly so many monsters is a bigger catastrophe.{nl}Of course, it's still better than at the capital. {nl}I've heard that it was completely destroyed during Medzio Diena.
I think this will be enough to destroy the idol.{nl}I'm grateful that we could get enough energy.{nl}
It's our only orb and it barely has enough power...{nl}We should try to think of a way to make sure we destroy the idol.{nl}
You've succeeded!{nl}The force that was weighing down my body is gone.{nl}
Now let's go find the orders we've hidden away.{nl}I know the way there, of course. That's why Marnox captured me...{nl}
I'll head down to the 3rd floor first.{nl}I think Gelija is there somewhere... I do hope that she is okay.{nl}
Priest Gelija is safe!{nl}Now I should focus on finding the Demon Orders.{nl}
But...{nl}Oh, I forgot that you probably won't be able to sense it.{nl}
I think there's a cursed idol here as well.{nl}The problem is that we don't have any Orbs of Return left.{nl}
Feeling as if my body is becoming heavier is one thing...{nl}But we cannot open the portal to the Penitence Room {nl}where the Demon Orders is because of the cursed idol.
We've prepared to greet the Revelator on the bishop's orders...{nl}But it looks like we'll be done for if we don't use it now.{nl}
We've hidden a sack of Pearl Powder in the watchtower.{nl}Do you think you could gather it?
Are you talking about the legends?{nl}Oh, you may not know since you're not from Orsha.{nl}
A long time ago...{nl}It is said that a young shepherd boy met a girl that {nl}he had never seen before while tending his sheep.{nl}
The girl barely talked, but everything she said happened.{nl}The shepherd boy was fascinated and took the girl to his uncle.{nl}
The uncle is said to have shown his respect as soon as he saw the girl.{nl}The girl prophesied of numerous catastrophes to the uncle before disappearing.{nl}
Medzio Diena and the catastrophe involving Orsha have already occurred...{nl}There is one more prophecy that has only been passed on by the bishops of Orsha.{nl}
You can hear the story in more detail from any of the residents of Orsha, {nl}so why don't you ask around?
It's an honor to meet the Revelator that I've only heard of through the legends. {nl}You really do seem to be indifferent to the curse as Priest Pranas said...{nl}
The bishop is meticulous... to the point of being overly cautious.{nl}He had prepared to meet the Revelator in a few more places other than here as well.{nl}
Among those numerous places, Ashaq Underground Prison was prepared by myself and Draznie.{nl}
I was planning on hiding here for a long time but...{nl}Since you're here, I think using the prepared items is a better idea.{nl}
First of all, I've hidden a sack of Pearl Powder in the watchtower.{nl}We can use that against demons to great effect.{nl}
I'll explain the details once you get back with the Pearl Powder.
It seems that I still have much to learn...{nl}I can't do anything because of the curse...
Thank the goddesses, Irma is safe!{nl}Now all we have to do is push the demons out of the Ashaq Underground Prison.
Once again, the bishop has impressed me with his wisdom.{nl}If such preparations hadn't been in place, {nl}we wouldn't have been able to deal with the demons at all.{nl}
I'd say that my brothers are also in similar hideouts.
I feel so relieved that we've recovered the Demon Orders.{nl}But this is only the beginning. We don't know the contents about it.
The pearl powder was scattered all over the floor?{nl}It seems as if the demons had torn into it.{nl}
Thankfully, this is more than enough to use.{nl}Good job on getting it here.
The demons also have a chain of command like we do,{nl}so I think that the other demons will fall if we take out their leaders.{nl}
I've crafted an orb from the pearl powder you brought me.{nl}Try using it when you find a demon far away.{nl}
I've empowered it with holy power so it will tell you which demons you need to deal with.
You mustn't... think of the demons as monsters.{nl}I've heard that some Demon Lords are as powerful as Goddess Gabija.
Good job.{nl}The demons will be less aggressive for a while since their chain of command is ruined.
I feel awful because of the cursed idols.{nl}I think I need to rest a little at the safer Special Prison District for a while.{nl}
We can also react to threats more easily thanks to its height.{nl}The only problem is that the demons are in control of it.{nl}
I feel guilty for asking for more help...{nl}But could you clear out the Special Prison District for us?
Priest Pranas, Auranas and myself...{nl}We are too weak from the cursed idols to be of any help.{nl}
I think we need to rest a bit more in the Special Prison District since it's safer than it is here.{nl}It's higher up so that reacting to threats will also be easier.{nl}
The problem is that the demons are in control of it.{nl}I know it's a lot to ask, but could you clear it out for us?
Especially Priest Pranas is in a bad state.{nl}Even though he's pretending to be fine just to make us less worried...{nl}
I ask of you to hurry since we can't be sure that this place will be safe despite the Goddess Statue.
Thank you.{nl}I'll have to lead the others to the Special Prison District when I see an opportunity.
I thought that I would be able to do anything once I got away from Marnox...{nl}But this curse is preventing me from doing anything.{nl}
I can finally be at ease thanks to you.{nl}It seems as if the Revelator sent by the goddesses is different after all...
You are an extraordinarily being to the priests of Orsha.{nl}We've prepared to meet you a long time only relying on legends.
Auranas is in a really bad state.{nl}Pretending to be okay in order so we can worry less isn't doing any good...{nl}
Since safety isn't guaranteed here despite the Goddess Statue, I must beg you to hurry.{nl}
Oh, thank you for helping out back then.{nl}You saved me from Marnox and even managed to retrieve the Demon Orders...{nl}
I feel much better now.{nl}I'm thinking of staying at the Ashaq Underground Prison {nl}for a while and driving the demons out of it.{nl}
I hope we get a chance to meet again.{nl}May the goddesses bless the path you choose...
Thank you.{nl}I'll have to wait for a chance to take them to the Special Prison District.
I'm so relieved that Irma is safe and sound.{nl}I'm sure she'll dust it off since she's so easygoing.{nl}

Oh, yes. {nl}We've made a bunch of traps in the Solitary Confinement District{nl}on the orders of the bishop quite some time ago.{nl}I learned this back when I was an apprentice... {nl}It's a trap to lure monsters to a apparition that looks like me.{nl}
I didn't say anything about them because I feared Irma {nl}might have gotten caught, but I think it's safe now.{nl}If you happen to go there, please be my guest and use the traps.{nl}
There are other places where we've prepared hideouts out of the prison as well.{nl}To exaggerate a little, we made so many that we could evacuate the population of Orsha.
Did the demons fall for the traps?{nl}I'd never used them on demons before, so I was a little worried.{nl}
I'm so glad that they worked as intended.{nl}
Do you... by any chance remember?{nl}I'm sure that the bishop would have mentioned it.{nl}
If you really are the Revelator, you will be able to stand against Demon Lords with your strength.{nl}
The reason we chose this place to hide the Demon Orders is because of the Confession Altar.{nl}It's the altar that the goddess gave her final blessing to the inmates that made their confessions.{nl}
It's been a while since the prison was shut down, but the effects from the blessings are still there.{nl}Your powers as Revelator should be enough to liberate that energy.
The cursed idols must be destroyed in order for me to open the portal to the Penitence Room.{nl}I can't do a thing because of this heavy and blasphemous energy.{nl}
There are two Confession Altars...{nl}But let's try the one on the left since it is closer.
The demons seemed to have noticed something is happening.{nl}But the cursed idol still stands...
I am grateful that everything seems to be going well ever since I've met you...{nl}But I am also nervous at the same time. {nl}Especially about the fact that Marnox is so quiet.
I told you there were two altars.{nl}Now all we can do is hope that the one in the oratory will do it's job.{nl}
I pray that the goddess look over us and grant us with success...
Please be careful that Marnox doesn't notice you.{nl}That arrogant Demon Lord will not look on as he lost me.
You've succeeded!{nl}I feel the curse being lifted.{nl}
Now, the cursed idols should be nothing more than mere pieces of wood!
You know what's strange?{nl}Marnox wouldn't leave us to interrupt his plans like this...{nl}
I guess it's all for the best.{nl}Maybe he underestimated you and got caught off guard.{nl}
Let's not let down the pace and go destroy the cursed idol in the 2nd Watchtower.{nl}I'll get the portal to the Penitence Room ready.
I won't forget the arrogant gestures and expressions Marnox used when he caught me.{nl}He said that he could crush the Revelator or anything else that stands in his way...
I thought it was strange that the demons weren't reacting...{nl}They've been preparing there all along.{nl}
But Marnox still didn't come back.{nl}Demons will never be able to open the chest that holds the Demon Orders,{nl}so where else could he be?{nl}
I guess he might be planning his next move while he sends his servants.{nl}I'll open the portal since we can't afford to tarry any longer.
Please be right behind me when I open the portal.{nl}Let's head back to the bishop as soon as we have the Demon Orders.
You've defeated Marnox...{nl}Euah...
{nl}I think my wounds are quite deep...
It was an honor that I could see the church achieve its mission.{nl}It's all thanks to you.{nl}
Don't worry about me, take the Demon Orders to the bishop.{nl}I'm a priest, remember? I'll be fine if I get to rest a little.
Is it true?{nl}You've... defeated Marnox?!{nl}
All we could do was run even when all of us attacked him together...{nl}I see that a Revelator has remarkable powers.{nl}
To see all the priests alive and well... it's a relief.{nl}I assume that we shall meet in Orsha soon.
I'm really okay. I'll recover my strength if I rest here a while, {nl}so please go and give the Demon Orders to the bishop.{nl}Don't forget to give him my regards.
Now that we've recovered the Demon Orders... Let's head back to Orsha.{nl}
The lord tends to attempt to act tough. She is strong, but gentle.{nl}I'm sure she's more worried than anyone else.{nl}
I'll head back to Orsha and meet with the lord before continuing {nl}with the interpretation of the Demon Orders.{nl}Why don't you meet with her again?
I shall see you in Orsha then.{nl}I'll make my leave since the interpretation of the Demon Orders is a pressing matter.
I have heard of what you've done from Bishop Urbonas.{nl}All that you've done for us... I don't know how to thank you.{nl}
I also knew of the legends passed down by the bishops of Orsha.{nl}I never thought that the Revelator of the same legends {nl}would be the one to save Bishop Urbonas...
The person that will save not only Orsha, but also the goddesses and the world...{nl}It is an honor to meet that Revelator.{nl}
It seems as if the goddesses have not forsaken Orsha even if they have all disappeared.{nl}I wish I could let everyone know of your deeds but...{nl}
I am sorry. I cannot announce that demons have come this close to the city.{nl}I hope that you will understand the fact that I {nl}cannot spread confusion and fear among my people.{nl}
I thank you once more as the lord of Orsha for what you have done.{nl}Bishop Urbonas will be waiting for you.
Greetings. Impeccable timing! {nl}I've just finished the final interpretation of the Demon Orders.{nl}
There may be a few parts where its inaccurate but...{nl}Allow me to explain with a bit of a liberal translation.{nl}
You may leave the human lord alone since we have obtained the holy power we were after.{nl}Miss Giltine wants more tangible results.{nl}
Deploy the Kruvina in the predetermined reservoir and execute the spore plan.{nl}Death will engulf this world.{nl}
P.S. Miss Giltine has ordered the annihilation of the Revelator.{nl}You must get rid of the Revelator before they meet the girl.{nl}
This is all of it.{nl}Its contents are so intimidating that I wonder if I actually translated it properly...{nl}
I will pass this information to the lord...{nl}It is frustrating since we can barely protect Orsha much less send out investigation parties.{nl}
What could this 'Kruvina' possibly be...{nl}I couldn't find anything mentioned in any of the old texts either.{nl}
Now, Revelator... What is your next plan?{nl}It may be simply the worries of an old man, {nl}but the spore plan mentioned in the Demon Orders...{nl}
Spores are merely the seeds of mushrooms or ferns and such.{nl}I can't help but wonder if the plan has anything to do with the Koru Jungle famed for its ferns...{nl}
The choice is yours, of course.{nl}Although our meeting may have been a coincidence, you did save me.{nl}
I am sure that the goddess has arranged it so that all of your travels lead to the salvation of all...{nl}
I bid thee well.{nl}I shall pray for the deliverance and blessings of the goddesses {nl}to lead and protect you on your journey.
I hope that you will keep a place in your heart for Orsha.{nl}The people of Orsha will always welcome you here.
Until now, we thought of the demons below Demon Lords...{nl}Little more than larger and more vicious monsters.{nl}

We never thought that they would have such a detailed{nl}command structure and threaten us like this.{nl}We will have to research their command structure in more detail {nl}to respond to them more effectively.{nl}
If you ever have the chance to face the demons at Felon Prison...{nl}Could you possibly collect Marnox's Insignias for me?{nl}{nl}
The entire church was swayed by a single Demon Lord...{nl}How powerful do you think a Demon King or Demon Goddess might be?
Thank you! {nl}I'll go straight to Orsha to research this subject as soon as things are settled here.{nl}
Ah... It is a pleasure to meet you.{nl}I've heard from Irma... that you're 'that Revelator'.{nl}
But we didn't know that they'd threaten us with such an organized structure.{nl}We'll need to confirm their command structure once things are settled here.{nl}
Could you gather Marnox's Insignias when you deal with the demons in the Felon Prison?{nl}I think we'll be able to research the demon's command structure with those.
It's a relief seeing Irma safe after being captured by Marnox.{nl}Now all we have to do is retrieve the Demon Orders.
I'm nervous. Especially about the fact that Marnox is so quiet...{nl}I'm sure that he's planning something behind the scenes.
I'm wounded myself...{nl}But I'm more worried about the condition the other priests are in.{nl}
I brought some potions and bandages in case something like this happened...{nl}But I had to leave them behind since we were chased by the demons.{nl}
I know it's a lot to ask, but you're the only one that can help.{nl}Could you find my medicine bags so I can cure the other priests?
The wounds of the other priests are severe, including Priest Irma.{nl}I brought potions and bandages just in case, but since we were chased by demons...{nl}
I am reluctant to ask the Revelator who has done so much but...{nl}Could you find my medicine bags so I can cure the other priests?
I know it is blasphemous, but I had always had my doubts about the Revelator.{nl}But you've defeated Marnox, who all of the priests together couldn't handle.{nl}
Now I know.{nl}Only you, who has been sent by the goddesses can really save the world...
Thank you so much for saving my colleagues.{nl}You ran in even though you knew that there were demons...
Hmm... Rose is really late.{nl}Should we wait a little bit more?
Not all priests can heal by miraculous powers.{nl}We have to put a stick next to the broken part and get medicine for the injury.
I do feel uncomfortable for the words I have used.{nl}Rose is still out and I am a bit worried.
What happened to the people of the Croa Village?{nl}And why are there demons here?
The last time I have visited here, there was no sight of a demon.. {nl}I am worried something awful has happened.{nl}Have you heard anything about this situation?
Thank you for getting me my missing bag.{nl}Right after I heal myself I have to go to the other priests.
